description:
The UI is nice, however, sometimes the computer gets stuck thinking or is thinking for too long. At other times, the game will permit illegal moves when you are checked (because it does not recognise you are checked and which by the way will also get the computer stuck). I was not able to finish a single game due to the computer always thinking too much or getting stuck. This applies to all of the algorithms (gnuchess, crafty, etc). If you get beaten and you click cancel, you can't undo. I guess that's the fair way, but sometimes it's good to be able to undo, try something different and learn.
To sum this up:
If you're new to chess you won't be able to learn very well because of some limitations. If you are more experienced, you will get the AI stuck thininking.
I tried this on Ubuntu 20.04 (Gnome), CPU is i7-9750H.
tried it. kicked my arse.those complaining most likely have old macine
Pychess didn't work on Kubuntu 21.04, so i tried this for FICS. Worked flawless, and the interface is minimalist, and therefore, soothing.
In order for the AI to work, you have to install additional compenents. No further information is provided. Besides that, the interface is worse than Windows' XP paint.
It seems it's impossible to disable the voicing of every movement. I cannot use the program this way. I'll try annother one.
yeah, i like to watch two computer engines play against each other
no me abre. me gustaría que la arreglasen pero segurito que me gusta.
C'est un jeux très intéressant où tu dois faire très attention, pour gagner il faut dire échec et mat "très stratégique et ludique je pense".
summary: C'est un jeux formidable, moi j'adore
